message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this product with you. I think you'll really appreciate its value and I'm confident you'll find it worth the investment. I'm willing to sell it to you for $20,000.
Alice, I appreciate your offer but $20,000 is above my budget.  I'm willing to pay $12,000 for the product. This is a fair price considering it's worth $15,000 to you.
I understand that $20,000 is a bit steep for you, but I still think the product is worth more than $12,000 to you. I'm willing to meet you in the middle and sell it to you for $18,000.
Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $18,000 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $14,000, which is a fair compromise considering your value for the product and my budget.

I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal, but I still need to make sure I get a good price for the product. I'm willing to meet you at $16,000, which is a bit higher than your last offer, but I think it's a fair compromise given the value the product has for you.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $16,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $15,000, which is a fair compromise considering your value for the product and my budget. This is my final offer.

I've gone back and forth with you, and I think we're really close to a deal. I'm willing to meet you at $15,000, but I want to make it a bit sweeter for you. I'll throw in some additional services and support that will make the product even more valuable to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15,000, but I'll also include a 6-month warranty and priority support. What do you think?
